vision.notes: Sticklebacks are ray-finned fishes, suggesting the presence of vision. They inhabit fresh, brackish, and marine waters. The blackspotted stickleback is found near floating vegetation, further supporting the importance of vision.

mechanoreception.notes: As ray-finned fishes inhabiting aquatic environments, sticklebacks likely possess a lateral line system for detecting water movement and pressure changes.

chemoreception.notes: Fish in general rely on chemoreception for finding food and mates.
